headline: Louisiana House revives Dont Say Gay bill with rare procedural move
author: Greg Larose
sentences: On the House floor Tuesday, Rep. Raymond Crews, R-Bossier City, asked his colleagues to discharge the rejected bill from committee and move it before the Committee of the Whole, on which all representatives have a vote.
Representatives can bring supporters and opponents to testify during the bills hearing, a process that has never happened on the House floor to the recollection of longtime legislative watchers.
With just two votes to spare, members revived a bill that would prohibit public school teachers and employees from discussing sexual orientation and gender identity with students.
Conservatives in the Louisiana House of Representatives turned to a seldom used procedure Tuesday to bring a controversial education proposal back from the dead.

The so-called Dont Say Gay? legislation from Rep. Dodie Horton, R-Haughton, failed to advance from the House Education Committee a week ago.
There was no immediate indication from House Speaker Clay Schexnayder, R-Gonzales, on when Hortons bill would be scheduled for a hearing.
Bills brought before the Committee of the Whole are handled much like any other proposal brought before a legislative panel.
Needing 53 members to support discharge the bill, the House voted 55-39 to back Crews motion.
